title: WIP: migration : cleanup alpha previous
description:
This MR is based on https://gitlab.com/metastatedev/tezos/-/merge_requests/132 where only commit touching proto_alpha have been  left.

This MR cleans all occurence of "alpha_previous" which where mainly used for `./scripts/snapshot_alpha.sh`. This script have been cleaned up of that in this MR https://gitlab.com/tezos/tezos/-/merge_requests/1949

title: CI: fix documentation rule for master
description:
The last commit replaced the except rule, but it should have extended
the rule which was inherited.

title: remove root from diff, remove get_size RPC
Fix operation data and metadata failing encodings/decodings

description: Closes #822

description: Fixes tezos/tezos#810

title: (Closed because targetting wrong branch)
description: (Closed because targetting wrong branch)

title: Doc: fix version 7.1 note since we backported client patches
description: Fix a sentence which made sense in a previous branch but which needed to be updated after we backported client patches.

title: Update to Lwt 5
description: New store needs it

title: Lib_crypto: add hacl-star
description: For now, it is purely artificial to decouple opam-repository update from switching hacl version.

title: Makefile: only list protocols with a TEZOS_PROTOCOL file
description:
If a protocol is deleted or moved, its `src/proto_XXX` directory
will probably remain when switching branch because of leftover files
which are ignored by Git. This is particularly annoying for users
which just want to `git pull && make`, as they face an error
`No rule to make target 'src/proto_plop/lib_protocol/TEZOS_PROTOCOL`.

This patch modifies the Makefile to only try to build protocols for which
there is actually a `TEZOS_PROTOCOL` file, instead of all `proto_*` folders.

title: Makefile: ignore opam error when checking if Merlin is installed
description:
If a user only has opam 2.0.0 (which we accept in our version check),
the command emits an error: `opam: unknown option --silent, did you mean -s ?`.
But actually compilation happens anyway.

Instead of requiring users to use opam 2.0.0, I redirect this error
to `/dev/null`. The only consequence is that users with opam 2.0.0
that use merlin will not run `dune build check` automatically, and thus
will get less precise "jump to definition" behavior.

title: Opam: fix tezos-version dependencies
description: !1489 modified some dependencies in `dune` files but not in the corresponding `.opam` files. This fixes that.

title: Tests/python: silence mypy errors
description:
`mypy 0.770` detect new errors. 

In particular, it doesn't infer correctly the type of `subprocess.Popen.__init__`. 
```
 subprocess.Popen.__init__(self, cmd, stdout=stdout, stderr=stderr)
```

By lack of a better solution, I silenced the warning.

title: Docs: fix links
description: Fixes a few errors returned when running `linkcheck` to build the documentation.

title: Expose `unparse_code` in script_ir_translator.mli
description:
This just exposes unparse_code in the .mli, for convenience.

This function is called when unparsing lambdas, ie converting from the typed IR to Micheline. It has a distinct performance profile and must be benched separately from unparse_data.

title: Sapling: add test for wallet (gen key and import key)
Marc@old mr
description: Old stuff from the nomadic remote

title: P2P: move errors to services
description: clients need to know about errors and not depend on implementations

title: WIP:  fix protocol build with final_protocol_version
Docs/Michelson: Clarify restriction on APPLY arguments
description:
Arguments must be both pushable and storable, as discussed in #753,
due to the implementation APPLY (PUSH _ _; PAIR).
